thread.title: Accused kidnapper Paul Jackson's return to Oregon underway
thread.title_full: Accused kidnapper Paul Jackson's return to Oregon underway | OregonLive.com

author: Emily E. Smith | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Accused kidnapper Paul Jackson's return to Oregon underway
text:
Accused kidnapper Paul Jackson, who was captured this week in Mexico after 24 years on the run, appeared in a California courtroom Wednesday and agreed to return to Oregon, Hillsboro police said.
Hillsboro detectives arrived in Los Angeles County, where Jackson is in jail, on Wednesday afternoon. After paperwork is completed, said Lt. Henry Reimann, Jackson will be turned over to their custody.
"They're hoping to bring him back" with them this week, Reimann said.
Detectives, he said, will try to meet with Jackson to interview him Wednesday night or Thursday.
Reimann said Jackson could be back in Washington County as soon as Thursday or Friday.
Jackson, 45, had been at large since 1991, when he and his older brother vanished while facing charges related to the kidnapping and torture of two young women in Portland.
Vance Roberts, Jackson's brother, was on the run for 15 years before he inexplicably surrendered in 2006 in Washington County. He's now serving a 108-year prison term .
Jackson was arrested Monday in Guadalajara, where he had been working in electronics, according to the U.S. Marshals Service.
CNN's "The Hunt with John Walsh" featured the case in July. Acting on a tip that came in after the show aired, U.S. Marshals said they discovered Jackson's whereabouts and learned he was living under the name Pablo Bennett.
-- Emily E. Smith
esmith@oregonian.com
503-294-4032; @emilyesmith
